article_node.title: Hurricane Erin: Mass. beaches closed as powerful storm brings huge waves, treacherous rip currents
article_node.summary: Massachusetts beaches along the southern coast are closed to swimming as Hurricane Erin moves north, bringing high surf and dangerous rip currents. The National Weather Service has issued high surf and coastal flood advisories, warning of waves up to 20 feet and potential road closures. Governor Maura Healey urges residents to stay safe, avoid the water, and help neighbors. Boaters and anglers are cautioned about strong winds and reduced visibility, with a gale watch in effect. The storm may intensify to a Categoryâ€¯3 hurricane as it continues northward.
